body:
We have the same issue. The UI completely freezes and the user is forced to close down the application. We use the `webFrame.setSpellCheckProvider`-api. If we disable this call, the application does not freeze anymore. In our case the freeze only seems to happen (or at least much more frequently) when you enter numbers into an input-field instead of text. You do not have to paste or enter lots of numbers/text.

### Electron Version ###
31.7.1 also tested with 33.0.0

### Last Known Working Electron version ###
31.7.0

### Operating system ###
Windows 10 Enterprise 10.0.19045

### What arch are you using? ###
x64

Thanks for reporting this and helping to make Electron better!

Because of time constraints, triaging code with third-party dependencies is usually not feasible for a small team like Electron's.

Would it be possible for you to make a standalone testcase with only the code necessary to reproduce the issue? For example, [Electron Fiddle](https://www.electronjs.org/fiddle) is a great tool for making small test cases and makes it easy to publish your test case to a [gist](https://gist.github.com) that Electron maintainers can use.

Stand-alone test cases make fixing issues go more smoothly: it ensure everyone's looking at the same issue, it removes all unnecessary variables from the equation, and it can also provide the basis for automated regression tests.

I'm adding the `blocked/need-info` label for this reason. After you make a test case, please link to it in a follow-up comment.

Thanks in advance! Your help is appreciated.

body: @mlaurencin Here is a gist which reproduces this issue. Simply enter numbers into the input field and the gui freezes. https://gist.github.com/ulrikdom/ebb409bdd637f9f2fc7c8bb258b2ca52 If you downgrade to 31.7.0 the issue goes away.

Note sure if this is of assistance. But since this seems to have been introduced in 31.7.1 my guess is that it's this commit that's caused this issue. https://github.com/electron/electron/commit/478defb15c036eb749617ad65633b4eecd02cc66

issue.title: Windows binaries of v0.0.104 not working

repository.name: electronim
repository.description: Electron based multi IM (Instant Messaging) client

issue.body:
I updated to v0.0.104 on Windows 11 using the binaries (exe and zip) and noticed freezing content in all tabs. I could click once then the current tab froze. Going to the next tab and click somewhere - same result.
I had 3 Slack and one WhatsApp tab.

I rolled back to v0.0.102 and everything's working as expected.

body:
> The UI completely freezes and the user is forced to close down the application. We use the webFrame.setSpellCheckProvider-api. If we disable this call, the application does not freeze anymore. 

We're also experiencing this issue (Windows, Linux) and also in v32 (will later confirm if it's still happening in v33, but it's very likely)

issue.title: 🐛 force native spell check until Electron issue is fixed

repository.name: electronim
repository.description: Electron based multi IM (Instant Messaging) client

issue.title: fix: custom spell-checker stuck in infinite loop

labels.name: merged/31-x-y
labels.description: PR was merged to the "31-x-y" branch.

labels.name: merged/32-x-y
labels.description: PR was merged to the "32-x-y" branch.

labels.name: merged/33-x-y
labels.description: PR was merged to the "33-x-y" branch.

labels.name: merged/34-x-y
labels.description: PR was merged to the "34-x-y" branch.

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
#### Description of Change

As reported in #44336, commit 478defb15c036eb749617ad65633b4eecd02cc66 now causes electron to freezes when using a custom spell checker.

`ReadUnicodeCharacter` updates index to the last character read, and not after it. We need to manually increment it to move to the next character.

It also doesn't validate that the index is valid, so we need to check that index is within bounds.

Refs: #44336


#### Checklist

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd

#### Release Notes

Notes: Fix custom spell checker getting stuck in infinite loop using 100% CPU.
